title: Stray Kids Woojin leaves K-Pop group weeks before comeback
text:
Woojin has left Stray Kids for personal reasons (Picture: Getty)

Stray Kids member Woojin has left the group.

JYP Entertainment announced on Monday that the K-pop star has decided to terminate his contract ‘due to personal circumstances’. The release date of the boy group’s new mini album Clé : LEVANTER has been pushed back to December.

The agency apologised to their fans STAY and asked them to continue to support Woojin in the future.

In a statement posted on the official fan messageboard, JYPE said: ‘Woojin, who has been with Stray Kids as a member until this time, has left the group due to personal circumstances and terminated his exclusive contract.

‘We express apologies for causing trouble to many fans with the sudden news.

‘As a result, Stray Kids’ mini album “Clé : LEVANTER,” which was scheduled for a November 25 release, will be delayed to December 9.

‘We once again express apologies to the fans who have waited for a long time.

The K-Pop group debuted in 2018 (Picture: Getty)

‘We ask for much support for Woojin who will be going on a new path, and we also ask for the warm support of STAY for the eight Stray Kids members who will once again go on the road towards their dreams with their compass.Thank you.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Fans began to trend the hashtag #ThankYouWoojin after hearing the news.

‘Woojin, it hurts like hell but we are praying for your future plans. Stay strong, be healthy always,’ read one comment from a STAY on Twitter.

‘Don’t stop dreaming. I’ll wait for your comeback in Stray Kids or as solo or anyhow. I’ll wait to see you perform on stage again,’ read another tweet.

A further comment read: ‘Thank you Woojin for all the beautiful moments you gave us as a part of Stray Kids, we are devastated to hear of your departure from the group. We wish all you all the best in the future, and we will endlessly give you our love and support. We’ll miss you.’

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Stray Kids was put together on a survival show and debuted in 2018 with nine members – Woojin, Bang Chan, Lee Know, Hyunjin, Changbin, Han, Seungmin, Felix and I.N.

Advertisement

Advertisement

They went on to release tracks such as MIROH, My Pace and Double Knot.

description: JYP Entertainment announces Woojin has left group for 'personal reasons' as comeback is delayed
